body_content.explanation: the spiritual part of a person that some people believe continues to exist in some form after their body has died, or the part of a person that is not physical and experiences deep feelings and emotions:
examples: She suffered greatly while she was alive, so let us hope her soul is now at peace.

body_content.explanation: the quality of a person or work of art that shows or produces deep good feelings:
examples: If you can't enjoy this music you've got no soul.
For me her paintings somehow lack soul.
Hip-hop artists draw on the music of the past - the blues, R&B, soul, and jazz.
The Atlanta-born singer is doing her best to revive old-school soul, including the music of Otis Redding, Aretha Franklin, and James Brown.

body_content.explanation: a person of a stated type:
examples: Some poor soul had fallen 500 metres to their death.
By the time I arrived there wasn't a soul there.

body_content.explanation: a deep understanding of and being proud of the culture of African-American people
